document_text:
This Statement of Work ("SOW") # 4916011688 adopts and incorporates by reference the terms and conditions of the ("Base Agreement") between Company A ("Buyer") and Company B ("Supplier"). This SOW is effective upon execution by both parties ("Effective July 1, 2017") and automatically terminates on June 30, 2018. Transactions performed under this SOW will be conducted in accordance with and be subject to the terms and conditions of this SOW, the Base Agreement and any applicable Work Authorizations ("WAs"). This SOW is not a WA.

The parties to this SOW agree that the terms of this SOW are effective retroactively as of July 1, 2017, notwithstanding the date that the parties to this SOW execute this SOW.

1.0 Scope of Work

Supplier will provide Deliverables and/or Services as specified in this SOW and/or WA in support of buyer's customer. Supplier will begin work only after receiving a WA from Buyer. Buyer may request changes to a SOW and/or WA and Supplier will submit to Buyer the impact of such changes. Changes accepted by Buyer will be specified in an amended SOW and/or WA or change order signed by both parties. Supplier agrees to accept all WAs that conform to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Supplier represents and warrants that any and all representations made and information provided by Supplier to Buyer and Affiliates in connection with this SOW, including that information provided within or in support of an RFP/RFQ, is accurate.

2.0 Definitions

The Definitions in the Base Agreement shall apply to this SOW.

2.1 Compliance with Environmental Laws

Supplier is responsible for complying with all Environmental Laws that restrict, regulate or otherwise govern Buyer's direct or indirect import, export, sale or other distribution of a product that is or contains Supplier's Products or Deliverables. "Environmental Laws" means those laws, rules and regulations of the United States (local, state and federal), Canada, European Union (EU), and other jurisdiction, country or country group that relate to environmental matters, including without limitation material restrictions, material bans, product labeling, availability of product environmental information, energy efficiency, end-of-life product take back, packaging, batteries and other similar requirements, including, but not limited to, for example, Regulation EC/1907/2006 concerning the Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH), and those laws of the European Union member states that implement Directive WEEE - - 2012/19/EU on waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE), Directive 2011/65/EU regarding restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances (RoHS) in electrical and electronic equipment and Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 October 2009 establishing a framework for the setting of eco-design requirements for energy-related products and its implementing measures.

As requested by Buyer, Supplier shall provide evidence of compliance with the legal requirements resulting from its obligations above (including, but not limited to labeling, information, registration, end-of-life product take back and recycling obligations, absence of restricted or banned substances, and other similar requirements) by suitable means, and shall assist Buyer with any reporting obligations related to a product which is or contains Supplier's Products or Deliverables. Supplier certifies that the information and data provided in accordance with the foregoing, as well as any other information or data provided in accordance with any applicable specifications is accurate, true and complete.

3.0 Description of Deliverables and Services

Attachment A - Description of Services

4.0 Supplier's Responsibilities

4.1 Supplier's Use of Subcontractors

Supplier's Use of Subcontractors

Without limiting Supplier's obligations under the Supplier's Subcontractor Obligations Section of the Base Agreement, Supplier may subcontract its works under this Agreement to a Subcontractor, provided however, that use of a Subcontractor will not relieve Supplier of the responsibility for the Subcontractor's performance, and Supplier's obligations and responsibilities assumed under this Agreement will be made equally applicable to all Subcontractors. Buyer reserves the right to reject Supplier's use of a Subcontractor in performance of this Agreement for any reason.

4.2 Asset Protection

In the event that assets are loaned to Supplier and there is no separate loan agreement in place between Buyer and Supplier for those assets, Supplier will be responsible for risk of loss and for the return of those assets to Buyer.

4.3 Financial Reporting

Upon Buyer request, Supplier will provide a Dun and Bradstreet report or similar report at Supplier's expense demonstrating Supplier's financial viability and solvency to Buyer.

4.4 Business Continuity

Supplier agrees to have and maintain a business continuity plan and business continuity testing procedures, which include but are not limited to the areas of disaster recovery planning and pandemic planning. Supplier agrees to review, update, and test the business continuity plan annually and, upon Buyer's request, Supplier will provide a summary of the business continuity plan and test results. Buyer may, from time to time, provide feedback regarding the plan and requests that Supplier take Buyer's comments into consideration when updating the plan. However, Supplier remains solely responsible for the performance of its responsibilities under the Agreement and the adequacy of the business continuity plan regardless of whether Buyer has reviewed or commented on the plan.

4.5 Payment Terms

The terms of payment are net 30 days either after receipt of Supplier's valid invoice or after receipt of the Deliverables or Services, whichever is later.

4.6 Travel Expense Guidelines

Buyer will reimburse Supplier for the following travel expenses only, provided they are incurred in the performance of this Agreement and with Buyer's prior written approval for the estimated costs and daily limits (as may be specified by Buyer): (i) tolls, parking fees, taxis, buses or auto rentals fees (ii) personal automobile use , excluding normal commutation; (iii) air transportation at the economy, tourist or coach class rate for the most direct route of a scheduled airline; (iv) reasonable lodging charges commensurate with the average rates charged for the immediate area (v) reasonable and actual meal expenses;> (vi) necessary business calls made on Buyer's behalf; (vii) reasonable tipping; (viii) reasonable valet and laundry charges if a trip extends beyond four (4) days. All reservations made by Supplier must be made through Buyer's designated travel agency or through another agency with Buyer prior written approval. Supplier must submit an invoice listing all travel expenses, and all applicable receipts for lodging, airline travel, rental cars or any other reimbursable expenditures to the Technical Coordinator listed in this SOW. Buyer will not reimburse Supplier for personal expenses.

5.0 Term

  • I. For the term of this SOW, Supplier will provide to Buyer the Break/fix Support Services, Preventive Maintenance and Deliverables as described in the Attachment entitled Description of Services.

6.0 Termination of SOW and/or WA

  • I. Buyer may, upon written notice to Supplier, terminate this SOW or WA:
    • a. With Cause, provided that Supplier shall have a thirty (30) day period from the date it receives notice of such Cause event to seek to cure such Cause event, if possible, and Buyer shall have the right to terminate this SOW or WA if Supplier is unable to cure such Cause event to the satisfaction of Buyer within such thirty (30) day period; or without Cause upon 30 days written notice, or such other period as the parties agree in writing.
    • b. Upon termination, in accordance with Buyer's reasonable written direction, Supplier will immediately: cease work; prepare and submit to Buyer an itemization of all completed and partially completed Deliverables and Services; deliver to Buyer Deliverables satisfactorily completed up to the date of termination at the agreed upon prices in the relevant SOW and/or WA; deliver upon request any work in process.
    • c. Buyer will compensate Supplier for work in process at a price to be mutually agreed upon by the parties in this SOW and/or WA; and Supplier shall not be obligated to transfer completed Deliverables or partially completed work in process until it receives payment in full hereunder from the Buyer for these items

7.0 Project Change Request (PCR)

Changes to this SOW may be requested by either party. Changes implemented under this procedure shall affect the SOW. A Project Change Request ("PCR") or an alternate mutually agreeable document will be used to communicate any requested change. The requesting party's project manager (or other designee) will draft the PCR and submit it to the other party's project manager (or other designee). The PCR should describe the changes, the rationale for the changes and the effect the changes will have on the SOW. The PCR must incorporate the SOW by reference and include an effective date. The parties will review the proposed change and approve it for further investigation, if any, or reject it. The investigation will validate the effect that the implementation of the PCR will have on price, schedule, service level agreements (SLAs) and other terms and conditions of the SOW. When there is agreement on the PCR, the SOW will be amended when the Supplier signs and Buyer's authorized Procurement representative countersigns the PCR. A Purchase Order or PO alteration that references the PCR may be issued by Buyer to authorize Supplier to perform as required by the PCR. The parties agree the terms of this SOW will supersede the term of the PO. The PCR is not a WA.

8.0 Pricing: see Attachment B - Fee Schedule

9.0 Communications

All communications between the parties will be carried out through the following designated coordinators or their designated successors or delegates, whom each party hereby designates as its representatives and contacts for this SOW. All notices required in writing under this Agreement will be made to the appropriate contact listed below at the following addresses and will be effective upon actual receipt. Notices may be transmitted electronically, by registered or certified mail, or courier. All notices, with the exception of legal notices, may also be provided by facsimile.

Business Coordinators

FOR SUPPLIER

FOR BUYER

Name

Name

Title

Title

Address

Address

Phone

Phone

Fax

Fax

E-mail

E-mail

Attachment A - Description of Services

Without limiting Supplier's obligations under the Supplier's Subcontractor Obligations Section of the Base Agreement, Supplier may subcontract its works under this Agreement to a Subcontractor, provided however, that use of a Subcontractor will not relieve Supplier of the responsibility for the Subcontractor's performance, and Supplier's obligations and responsibilities assumed under this Agreement will be made equally applicable to all Subcontractors.

In the event that assets are loaned to Supplier and there is no separate loan agreement in place between Buyer and Supplier for those assets, Supplier will be responsible for risk of loss and for the return of those assets to Buyer.
Upon Buyer request, Supplier will provide a Dun and Bradstreet report or similar report at Supplier's expense demonstrating Supplier's financial viability and solvency to Buyer.

Supplier agrees to have and maintain a business continuity plan and business continuity testing procedures, which include but are not limited to the areas of disaster recovery planning and pandemic planning.
Supplier agrees to review, update, and test the business continuity plan annually and, upon Buyer's request, Supplier will provide a summary of the business continuity plan and test results.
Buyer may, from time to time, provide feedback regarding the plan and requests that Supplier take Buyer's comments into consideration when updating the plan.

However, Supplier remains solely responsible for the performance of its responsibilities under the Agreement and the adequacy of the business continuity plan regardless of whether Buyer has reviewed or commented on the plan.
The terms of payment are net 30 days either after receipt of Supplier's valid invoice or after receipt of the Deliverables or Services, whichever is later.

Buyer will reimburse Supplier for the following travel expenses only, provided they are incurred in the performance of this Agreement and with Buyer's prior written approval for the estimated costs and daily limits (as may be specified by Buyer):
(i) tolls, parking fees, taxis, buses or auto rentals fees
(ii) personal automobile use , excluding normal commutation;
(iii) air transportation at the economy, tourist or coach class rate for the most direct route of a scheduled airline;
(iv) reasonable lodging charges commensurate with the average rates charged for the immediate area
(v) reasonable and actual meal expenses;>
(vi) necessary business calls made on Buyer's behalf;
(vii) reasonable tipping;
(viii) reasonable valet and laundry charges if a trip extends beyond four (4) days.
All reservations made by Supplier must be made through Buyer's designated travel agency or through another agency with Buyer prior written approval.

Supplier must submit an invoice listing all travel expenses, and all applicable receipts for lodging, airline travel, rental cars or any other reimbursable expenditures to the Technical Coordinator listed in this SOW.
Buyer will not reimburse Supplier for personal expenses.
I. For the term of this SOW, Supplier will provide to Buyer the Break/fix Support Services, Preventive Maintenance and Deliverables as described in the Attachment entitled Description of Services.
I. Buyer may, upon written notice to Supplier, terminate this SOW or WA:

a. With Cause, provided that Supplier shall have a thirty (30) day period from the date it receives notice of such Cause event to seek to cure such Cause event, if possible, and Buyer shall have the right to terminate this SOW or WA if Supplier is unable to cure such Cause event to the satisfaction of Buyer within such thirty (30) day period; or without Cause upon 30 days written notice, or such other period as the parties agree in writing.

Changes to this SOW may be requested by either party.
Changes implemented under this procedure shall affect the SOW.
A Project Change Request ("PCR") or an alternate mutually agreeable document will be used to communicate any requested change.
The requesting party's project manager (or other designee) will draft the PCR and submit it to the other party's project manager (or other designee).
The PCR should describe the changes, the rationale for the changes and the effect the changes will have on the SOW.
The PCR must incorporate the SOW by reference and include an effective date.
The parties will review the proposed change and approve it for further investigation, if any, or reject it.
The investigation will validate the effect that the implementation of the PCR will have on price, schedule, service level agreements (SLAs) and other terms and conditions of the SOW.
When there is agreement on the PCR, the SOW will be amended when the Supplier signs and Buyer's authorized Procurement representative countersigns the PCR.

The parties agree the terms of this SOW will supersede the term of the PO.

8.0 Pricing: see Attachment B - Fee Schedule

All communications between the parties will be carried out through the following designated coordinators or their designated successors or delegates, whom each party hereby designates as its representatives and contacts for this SOW.
All notices required in writing under this Agreement will be made to the appropriate contact listed below at the following addresses and will be effective upon actual receipt.
Notices may be transmitted electronically, by registered or certified mail, or courier.
All notices, with the exception of legal notices, may also be provided by facsimile.
